message.content: This question asks about what creates no pollution. Option (B) states that mills that make energy from the wind do not create pollution. This is because wind energy is a renewable energy source and does not produce harmful emissions or pollution. Option (A) is incorrect because natural fuels like coal or gas do create pollution when they are burned. Option (C) is incorrect because buildings that make large quantities of items can contribute to pollution through the manufacturing processes. Option (D) is also incorrect because transportation contraptions with four wheels, such as cars, can emit pollutants from their exhaust systems.

This question requires knowledge about pollution and its sources. Option (B) is the correct answer because mills that make energy from the wind, also known as wind turbines or wind farms, do not emit pollution. They harness the wind's energy to generate electricity without burning fossil fuels or producing harmful emissions. Option (A) is incorrect because natural fuels like coal or gas can pollute the environment when burned. Option (C) is incorrect because buildings that produce large quantities of items can contribute to pollution through energy usage and waste generation. Option (D) is incorrect because transportation contraptions with four wheels, such as cars, can emit pollution depending on the type of fuel they use and their emissions control systems.

This question requires knowledge about different sources of energy and their impact on the environment. Option (B) is the correct answer because wind mills, also known as wind turbines, generate electricity without producing any pollution. They harness the power of the wind to generate clean, renewable energy. Option (A) is incorrect because natural fuels like coal or gas can release harmful pollutants into the air when burned. Option (C) is incorrect because large-scale manufacturing processes in buildings can contribute to pollution. Option (D) is incorrect because transportation contraptions with four wheels, such as cars, typically use fossil fuels and contribute to air pollution.

Wind mills or turbines harness the power of the wind to generate electricity without emitting harmful pollutants. Option (A) is incorrect because coal and gas are fossil fuels that release pollutants when burned. Option (C) is incorrect because large-scale production in buildings can contribute to pollution. Option (D) is incorrect because transportation contraptions with four wheels, such as cars, can contribute to air pollution through the burning of fossil fuels.

Wind energy is considered a clean and renewable source of energy, as it does not produce pollution or greenhouse gas emissions. Option (A), natural fuel like coal or gas, is incorrect because burning these fuels does produce pollution. Option (C), buildings that make large quantities of items, is incorrect because manufacturing processes can contribute to pollution. Option (D), transportation contraptions with four wheels, is also incorrect because vehicles with four wheels can still create pollution depending on their fuel source.
